title: The solution to mobility creep is in the game already. We just need to change a few interactions.
body:
1. A champion's dash is now considered to be at 100% effectiveness when their current movement speed matches their default movement speed. When their current movement speed is diminished, their dash range is diminished by an equal amount. 

 What this means: Slows will actually slow champs, since nearly everybody can just dash over a slow field now. For point and click abilities, a champ with a (say) 500 range leap will, with a 25% slow, have a 375 range leap for the duration of the slow effect. This affects non-targeted blinks and Flash as well.

 Does not affect champions whose current ms is higher (though that would be an interesting ability for an item or a support).

 If Zed does not currently have a range limit to his shadow hopping, he should, and then this can affect him too. Slowing him to keep him from popping away is counterplay, and he could use some.

2. Roots (snares, immobilizes, etc) will prevent champions from using movement abilities already. What they should do is stop them dead upon application as well.

 What this means: Roots will stop a champion from just jumping onto you anyway and killing you while they're "immobilized" next to you. Jumping animations (Tristana, Jax) will drop to the ground immediately at a sensible point along their flight path (where they would be if it was just a dash towards their destination). 

 Bullshit like Fizz's dash doing damage when he launches and not when he hits you will also be fixed. When a champion stops, if they are not within autoattack range they do not deal damage.

 Ultimates that specifically prevent this (Vi) will be unaffected.

 For the reply:

 When you howl into the night sky that your OP as fuck main will be ruined forever by these changes, consider a list of champions who will be "ruined" in this way, and then consider the health of a game with that list of champions getting nerfs they sorely need. I think you will get over it. This is a better solution to the very real problem of mobility creep than reworking every champ who abuses their mobility (which is nearly all of them). A few of them will still need additional work, of course. You know who they are.
 ~Uiru

A good example is try to see how many spells you can name that changes range with skill level. I think it is only cait ult, syndra ult and one more i can't remember. Increasing cd on dashes or the speed they have would be better.

I agree. This seems like a great way to affect mobility creep without causing a massive rework of the system. Champs still dash their full distance (and thus don't have a problem reaching enemies/going over walls), but still makes the slow relevant against champions with lots of dashes. Even Lee (and anybody else with a targeted dash) gets a clear effect placed on him. It's not game-breaking or crippling to high mobility champs.

Truth, this makes sense. But further more, I believe that blinks like those two shouldn't be affected by snares. You get tangled in plants, but have a teleport ability, you should e able to use it. Depending on the ability, it could persist afterwards, but still work.

Would require a huge amount of champion rebalancing.  There are so many incidental slows in kits and they just became incredibly powerful.

Consider just how crazy Irelia becomes, for example.  Her E is supposed to be "use me when you're lower health than the opponent" but now she doesn't really care, because she gets to stick to the target no matter what.

Also, Irelia brings up another relevant question: she has a targeted gap closer like just about every bruiser.  If a bruiser is slowed by 30%, does that mean the gap closer only goes 70% of the way to the target?

The intended interaction that I am proposing is that if the command is locked in, nothing changes. If it is not and you are slowed, the range of the gap closer is reduced to 70% until the slow wears off. You aren't able to click the minion or ward until your mobility is restored.

 The infliction of slow would have to be made more prominent, of course, because (as pointed out several times already) this kind of change would make slows relevant (they currently aren't to many champs).

 The proposed animation slow instead is interesting as well. The purpose is to make slows work as a counter to mobility, which makes sense, rather than mobility being a counter to slows, which is what we currently have. (And remember, champs pay for slows in their kit, they don't pay for mobility.)
 ~Uiru
